question: How do I do manual testing?

answers.a: Use automated tools to scan content only
answers.b: Follow a checklist to manually inspect content for accessibility
answers.c: Check content on a single device

question: What is WCAG?

answers.a: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines
answers.b: World Consortium for Accessibility Goals
answers.c: Web Communication Accessibility Group

question: What is ARIA?

answers.a: Accessible Rich Internet Applications
answers.b: Assistive Resource Information Attribute
answers.c: Alternative Resource for Interactive Accessibility

question: When is a scan appropriate?

answers.a: When validating manual accessibility testing results
answers.b: When checking usability only
answers.c: As a replacement for manual testing

question: How can I determine if text is real or an image?

answers.a: Check if you can highlight the text with a cursor
answers.b: Inspect the text with a magnifying glass
answers.c: Look for shadows around the text

question: Why is using headings for style a bad practice?

answers.a: It disrupts screen reader navigation
answers.b: It makes the text less readable
answers.c: It makes the page harder to load

question: What format can I have complex tables?

answers.a: PDF only
answers.b: HTML
answers.c: Plain text documents

question: What is the importance of a table caption?

answers.a: It provides a visual style to the table
answers.b: It describes the purpose or content of the table
answers.c: It helps in exporting the table to other formats

question: What is a skip link?

answers.a: A link to skip to a different website
answers.b: A tool for bypassing repetitive content on a page
answers.c: A feature that skips broken links

question: Why should links be visually distinct from the surrounding text?

answers.a: To improve readability for all users
answers.b: To comply with SEO best practices
answers.c: To make the page look visually appealing

question: What is the role of links in menus?

answers.a: To navigate users between content sections or pages
answers.b: To provide descriptive captions for images
answers.c: To replace buttons for form submissions

question: What are key characteristics of an accessible button?

answers.a: It has a unique style and hover effects
answers.b: It is keyboard operable and provides a clear label
answers.c: It changes color when clicked

question: What is appropriate color contrast?

answers.a: A ratio of 3:1 between text and background
answers.b: A ratio of 4.5:1 between text and background
answers.c: A ratio of 2:1 between text and background

question: What is haptic feedback?

answers.a: Vibrations or tactile sensations to provide feedback
answers.b: Audio cues for user interactions
answers.c: Visual effects to highlight user actions

question: What is alt text?

answers.a: A detailed description of an image
answers.b: Text that appears when an image cannot load
answers.c: A short description conveying the purpose of an image

question: How long should alt text be?

answers.a: As concise as possible while conveying the image's purpose
answers.b: At least 50 characters
answers.c: A full sentence

question: What laws govern accessibility requirements for higher education institutions?

answers.a: Section 504 and Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act
answers.b: FERPA
answers.c: HIPAA

question: What role do faculty members play in creating an accessible learning environment?

answers.a: They develop accessible content and accommodate students' needs
answers.b: They ensure facilities are ADA-compliant
answers.c: They rely solely on IT to implement accessibility

question: What types of assistive technologies support students in higher education?

answers.a: Screen readers, text-to-speech, and braille displays
answers.b: Keyboards and mice
answers.c: Digital projectors and speakers

question: Which ARIA attribute is used to describe the current state of an element?

answers.a: aria-label
answers.b: aria-describedby
answers.c: aria-live
